Redo
Use two lists or just undoList and a pointer?
Behavior:
Add undo entries as usual
But additionally move pointer
When popping entry, decrease pointer and restore item at index
When now pushing an entry, clear entries after the current item before pushing current state
When doing redo, increase pointer and restore item at index
When at the end of the list (after going down and up again), an undo adds a useless entry
When at index -1 with non-empty list, restore lags by one

Windows specific
Prompt has problems with German umlauts (probably a general Unicode problem)
Umlauts are displayed correctly in the items and in the prompt when loading from JSON; it's just entry that seems to be the problem
Crashes also when not in the prompt, and also when pasting instead of entering
There seems to be an existing issue: https://github.com/charmbracelet/bubbletea/issues/153
After changing the system settings to force UTF-8, it no longer crashes, but umlauts (and space!) don't work
Issue with space fixed locally in textinput.go (see also https://github.com/charmbracelet/bubbles/issues/144)
We're going deep, boys: https://nullprogram.com/blog/2020/05/04/
Problem might be that normal CONIN reports wide chars, even if system is otherwise configured for UTF-8
This behavior would have to be fixed in cancelreader, I think

assumption is that a read returns all runes, but we might have received only a part of multibyte UTF-8 encoded rune and must read more (keeping the start part here) for 'ß', we expect 0xc3 0x9f in UTF-8, but when the error occurs, it's 0xe1 (which is also NOT 'ß'' in the Windows-1252 codepage or the ISO/IEC 8859-1 codepage, where it is 0xdf) This overwiew (https://www.torsten-horn.de/techdocs/encoding.htm) show us: 'ß'' is 0xe1 in Codepage 437 and Codepage 850. After setting the system wide codepage to UTF-8, ReadConsoleInput yields 0xdf for 'ß'
Might also be relevant: https://forum.golangbridge.org/t/windows-raw-console-i-o/22487
Other discussion: https://groups.google.com/g/golang-nuts/c/our8DRS9gaU

Shortcut navigation

Devlog
I like the way Go allows overwriting dependencies (even deeply transitive ones) with local versions a lot
This does not even require a rebuild of the dependency or any of its referencing modules, but just a rebuild of the final top level consumer module!
bubbletea is really nice to use
For example, viewport integration for scrolling has been extremely straight forward
Except for the fact that my h/j navigation was hijacked, but that was my own fault
